comment: Dr. Tierce is exactly the kind of professor I looked for in film studies. Not only is he passionate about film, he is passionate about teaching film. Look no further if you're looking to enhance your understanding of cinema.

Not one of the best film professors I've had, but he is knowledgable and can be entertaining. His lectures can be pretty long and he rarely lets out early. Each film requires a reading and film response and there are 3 tests and essays. He is a very nice guy and wants his students to do well.

I dont know how he doesn't have better ratings. This is undoubtedly one the best and easiest classes I've taken. I can't believe I'd ever actually be looking forward to class in a Maymester but Dr. Tierce made that happen. Hilarious teacher, watching movies, interesting, and open note tests. What more do you want?

Tests are difficult, but there is enough "gimme" work in the class to make an A. He gives a positive attendance grade, not just a punishment for absences. Not nearly the easiest film teacher in the department, but he is friendly, funny, and obnoxiously clear about the requirements of the class ("say yes if you understand").

Mike Tierce is one of the most engaging professors at this school. I wish I could take him all the time. He is strict, MUST attend, but he is NOT boring in any way. His required writings & book readings need to be done before every class, 3 hrs once a week is great. His 4 film reviews are not difficult, tests are hard, pay attention. LOVE!

Take this teacher! No doubt one of the top 100 at this university! Attendance is mandatory, but you get points for. He requires reading/film responses every single class, tests are essay & multiple choice. He is funny, engaging and door always open for help. He is not boring at all, and I really enjoyed this class.

Attendance is ABSOLUTELY mandatory. He'll take off points if you're not there. But he offers extra credit, too. If you take notes on the movie and print the ones he gives you online, the tests are a PIECE OF CAKE. Those who  have trouble must not pay any attention at all. Seriously. There's even a pattern on his tests. EASY. TAKE HIM.

Prof.Tierce is definitely an English teacher.  Cares more about dotting i's and crossing t's than actual content of papers.  Made an A in class but never once was recognized for a good paper.  Control freak in class.  Hardly any discussion.  Always lectures.  Open notes and book tests. Study notes and show up for class.  No excuse for not passing.
Great Professor.  Easy to talk with if you have questions, open notes test, you'll do well if you show up and take notes in class.  Awesome, I would totally take another class with him!
Great professor. Makes the class fun, but informative.

Class is easy. Attendance isn't required, but you use the class notes on tests and also get points for going to class. It's kind of boring, but he is funny and makes the three hours go by as painlessly as possible. No text book, everything is on vista.

Very interesting, easy class (Studies in Film). You learn a lot about observing the intentional decisions made in film-making to convey subliminal messages. Tests are open notes, but don't skimp on the word count for the essays and make sure you proofread - he is an English teacher :). Very funny guy, too. Great class.

Hilarious and incredibly knowledgeable about the subject. If he stops the film to point something out, write it down! There are a few essays, but there are plenty of "gimme" points like turning it in on time and having a works cited page. Highly recommended to any student.

I really ended up liking this class more than I thought. I wish that we had discussed more films, but five in a semester is good. Dr. Tierce does not take role, but does have tests, quizzes, reading responses, and essays due. You can use notes on your tests. My advice is to complete the learning outcomes essay and reading responses early. Fun class

Dr. Tierce is hilarious, and his knowledge of film is extensive.  We had to write for each class and read two or three articles on film to prepare.  He gives a ton of notes, expects everyone to attend, and he his tests focus on class discussions, plus you need good notes in order to perform well on the tests.  Highly Recommended.
One of the best classes I've taken. He's a TON of fun and really knows his stuff. Take a ton of notes on EVERY word he says and you'll do great.

Tierce is a good professor. Class was fun and entertaining. He knows his Hitchcockian Film Noir, so be prepared to regurgitate what he teaches in class on tests. You have to show up or have great notes to do well on the tests. Seems a bit unapproachable 1 on 1, but very cool when speaking to the class (40 people). 7/10

Very Cool&Laid back,giggles A LOT(it's normal so don't worry),Lectures very fast but if u take good notes you'll do FINE on the tests(but very picky write ALL INFO YOU HAVE on ur test 2 get full credit)Very Picky about GRAMMAR on Take home essays,but very FAIR grader.Not hard at all.6 books to read. 2 outside projects. 3 tests.HIGHLY RECOMMENDABLE!
Crazy old man who really loves his Hitchcock and Film Noir.
Very laid back, funny, and knows his stuff.  Take his film classes, you'll love them!
